image.altText: Bridge under construction

props.synopsis: Crews are working to rectify a "problem" identified during the ongoing construction of a new $786 million bridge north of Hobart, which has resulted in two parts of the structure not lining up â€” but the Tasmanian government is adamant it won't cause delays or cost any money.

title.children: Bridgewater Bridge 'problem' won't cause delay or cost money, Tasmanian government says

image.altText: Drone image of wind turbines on coastline.

props.synopsis: Tasmania is headed for a 15-year low in its renewable energy generation â€” posing a threat to the state's claim of being "100 per cent renewable".

title.children: Dry spell undoes Tasmania's claim of being 100 per cent powered by green energy

image.altText: Smoke emerges from the top of a large white and red cruise ship at night with lights reflected in water below.

props.synopsis:
Business owners and travellers are facing extensive wait times to get large vehicles onto the Spirit of Tasmania, with one local business owner scaling down her pet transport service due to ongoing vehicle booking shortages.

Â

title.children: Travellers and businesses face months-long wait for Spirit bookings, but new ships won't be operational until 2026

image.altText: An aerial view of a retirement village surrounded by a body of water. The buildings have matching grey rooves.

props.synopsis: Retirement villages are governed by a patchwork of laws that differ from state to state but advocates want tougher regulation of the sector. Could treating the sector like a "financial product" be the answer, and how would it work?

title.children: Should retirement villages be treated like 'financial products'?

image.altText: Writer Jodi Wilson wears a hat and scarf while walking on a beach in north-west Tasmania.

props.synopsis: Jodi Wilson thought she would return to NSW after caravanning around Australia with her family. Instead travel inspired a change of plan.

title.children: Discovery of 'slow, simple life' leads caravanning family to make Tasmania home

image.altText: Artist impression of proposed waterside development in Hobart.

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence (AI) was used by the Tasmanian government to validate a developer's claim about the economic benefits of a contentious luxury hotel planned for Hobart, new documents reveal.

title.children: 'Cooking the books': Tasmanian government used AI to validate developer's hotel claims

image.altText: An older woman in a grey knitted jumper and an older man in a green flannelette shirt stands in their Earthship.

props.synopsis: Immune to power outages, the couple generate their own electricity using solar panels, and only use an estimated 2 kWh per day.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ State's recent power outages highlight benefits of living off-grid

image.altText: Multiple boats in ocean including Border Force patrol boat and small illegal fishing vessel

props.synopsis: Saibai Islanders say they have been left to "fend for themselves" as confrontations over illegal fishing expose flaws in border security, putting their livelihoods and safety at risk.

title.children: Islanders left to defend Australian border warn 'someone will get hurt' unless government acts

image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann is able to appeal against the result of his failed defamation case, after a Federal Court judge dismissed an application for him to pay a security of costs before any appeal goes ahead.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann cleared to proceed with defamation case appeal

image.altText: A man's leg with a purple rash on it.

props.synopsis: Doctors say scurvy, best associated with sailors' lack of fresh fruit and vegetables on long sea voyages, is a "re-emerging diagnosis" â€” partly due to cost-of-living pressures.

title.children: Australian man diagnosed with scurvy, a disease doctors 'thought we had eradicated'

image.altText: A group of about twenty people dressed all in black with their faces covered.

props.synopsis: Police have used capsicum spray on a group of neo-Nazis who disrupted an asylum seeker rally in Melbourne's Docklands last night.

title.children: Victorian premier lashes neo-Nazi 'cowards' who disrupted asylum seeker rally in Melbourne

image.altText: Hezbollah leader Hashem Safieddine

props.synopsis: On Wednesday morning, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) confirmed Safieddine died in the attack three weeks ago which also killed 25 other Hezbollah leaders.

title.children: Israel's military confirms killing of expected Hezbollah successor Hashem Safieddine

image.altText: Eminem wears a hoodie and holds a microphone as he raps on a stage.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris is looking to her celebrity backers for a tie-breaking boost as the American presidential election campaign enters its final fortnight.

title.children: Eminem, Springsteen join Kamala Harris campaign as Democrats seek celebrity boost in deadlocked race

image.altText: A brown snake rearing up with it's mouth open, on red grassy soil.

props.synopsis: A toxicologist warns it's never safe to assume a snake bite is free of venom, after a South Australian man experiences a delayed reaction to poison from a suspected brown snake bite.

title.children: Snake bite victim's 'unusual' 15-hour wait before venom kicks in

image.altText: A man with blond hair wearing a suit looks into the distance

props.synopsis: The 80-year-old is accused of baiting young men with the prospect of modelling jobs so they could be abused.

title.children: Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO Mike Jeffries faces life in prison over US federal sex trafficking charges

image.altText: A QBE logo on the side of a tan brick building surrounded by green tree branches.

props.synopsis: The corporate regulator has launched court action over renewal notices sent to more than 500,000 customers that promised discounts that weren't always delivered. QBE has apologised and says it has cooperated with ASIC.

title.children: 'Unacceptable': ASIC sues QBE for allegedly misleading customers over loyalty discounts

image.altText: A graphic hows two men shaking hands with blue shining behind him and red shining behind the other man.

props.synopsis: Cost of living, youth crime, health and housing have been in the spotlight ahead of Queensland's election on Saturday. Here are the major pledges that have been made.

title.children: Here's what the major parties are promising ahead of the Queensland election

image.altText: Older indigenous men stand behind a wide gate labelled Kinchela Boys Home

props.synopsis: The 49 Indigenous survivors from Kinchela Boys Home want to turn the site into a museum and place of healing as they mark 100 years since the institution began operations.

title.children: Stripped naked, heads shaved and given a number to replace their name. Survivors of boys home share their stories

image.altText: a close up of carroll

props.synopsis: Queensland's former police commissioner has been accused of striking a deal with the state's powerful police union not to release "damaging reports" they commissioned in the belief the service did not "need more bad press", according to an internal email seen by the ABC.

title.children: 'I couldn't unsee what I saw': Officers involved in unreleased review of pilot program to transform Queensland Police speak out

image.altText: Xi Jinping and Narendra Modi waive at the camera while standing in front of Indian and Chinese flags respectively

props.synopsis: Troops from China and India have been involved in a tense stand-off for years high in the Himalayas, but a new deal raises the prospect of a peaceful future.

title.children: Some 120,000 troops have been 'eyeball-to-eyeball' in the Himalayas for years. A new deal could see them step down

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 is trading higher, with Qantas's share price hitting an all-time record. Meanwhile, ASIC is suing insurer QBE for allegedly misleading customers over premium discounts. Follow live.

title.children: ASX 200 higher, Qantas shares hit all-time high as some engineers walk off the job

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Striking Qantas engineers unlikely to cause flight cancellations
Coles and Woolworths front court over fake discount claims

image.altText: A wide McDonald's storefront logo including the golden yellow 'M'

props.synopsis: The United States' leading public health organisation has identified 49 cases of the bacterial infection and one person has died.

title.children: One dead and dozens infected in US McDonald's E. coli outbreak

image.altText: Mickey the cockatoo in Macarthur Square Shopping Centre walking towards a trolley

props.synopsis: A cockatoo named Mickey became trapped inside Macarthur Square Shopping Centre at Campbelltown in Sydney's south-west last month. He "took up residence" at the Coles supermarket before he was captured by local bird expert yesterday.

title.children: 'She helped me lure him': How bird expert captured cockatoo stuck in supermarket for weeks

image.altText: Couple cuddle in bed

props.synopsis: The "other woman" in an affair with a married man is often the subject of scorn. Three women reveal why they choose to stay with their secret lover.

title.children: It's not just sex: why these women choose to be the secret partner in an affair

image.altText: Christopher Yoo at the 2024 US Chess Championships.

props.synopsis: Christopher Yoo was arrested by the police in the US city of St Louis after he allegedly struck a female videographer following a defeat in the United States Chess Championship.

title.children: 'It was a serious mistake': Chess grandmaster arrested after allegedly punching videographer after loss

image.altText: New Indonesian ministers salute during their inauguration

props.synopsis: Mugiyanto thought he would die after being abducted by soldiers in 1998 when Prabowo Subianto was a powerful special forces commander. Now the former human rights advocate has joined the Indonesian president's cabinet.

title.children: Prabowo's cabinet inaugurated as human rights groups decry a new 'undemocratic Indonesia'

image.altText: Young women's face with sunglasses on her head

props.synopsis: One in four women will experience pain during sex that can affect their self-worth and their relationships. These people say pelvis floor specialists can improve women's lives.

title.children: Sex was 'unbearable' for Daisy until she went to see a physiotherapist

image.altText: A shop on fire

props.synopsis: An evacuating resident has captured on video the moment fire engulfs a NSW tobacco shop after a suspected ram raid attack in the early hours of the morning.

title.children: 'Oh my god, get out of the house': Residents evacuated after suspected ram raid attack sparks dramatic blaze at tobacconist

image.altText: Two images of black cockatoo's superimposed over bushland and sand mining.

props.synopsis: An Australian minerals company wants to clear about 1,000 hectares of threatened native banksia woodlands for two WA mining projects. Â

title.children: Sand miner's push to clear vulnerable banksia forest draws criticism from conservationists

image.altText: Film director Roman Polanski

props.synopsis: The director, who fled the US decades ago after admitting to the statutory rape of a minor will no longer face trial over another case of alleged assault in 1973.Â

title.children: Roman Polanski's 1973 sexual assault case formally dismissed

image.altText: Cricketer David Warner speaks to media at a press conference, talking and holding his hands up

props.synopsis: With no candidate rising above the pack as a viable replacement, former Test opener David Warner says he has "cheekily messaged" the Australian selectors to let them know he would be open to coming out of retirement.

title.children: 'I'm always available': Retired David Warner puts his hand up for return to Test opener role

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and glasses looks ahead

props.synopsis: The head of GFG Alliance Sanjeev Gupta says there will be no more job losses at the Whyalla steelworks, while not being able to give a firm timeline on when he expects the blast furnace to come online again.Â

title.children: Whyalla steelworks owner promises no more job cuts with blast furnace to be fixed in 'days or weeks'

image.altText: Two feet stuck between two large boulders.

props.synopsis: Photographs have emerged of the remarkable rescue of Matilda Campbell, 23, who fell three metres into a rock crevice in the NSW Hunter Valley earlier this month.

title.children: Images show dramatic rescue of woman left hanging by feet for seven hours after attempt to retrieve phone
